query:
SELECT DISTINCT ?item ?itemLabel ?accusedurl ?chargeLabel ?residenceLabel ?coords ?image (?Appears as ?layer) 
WHERE 
{
  ?item wdt:P31 wd:Q5.
  ?item wdt:P4478 ?accused .
  wd:P4478 wdt:P1630 ?formatterurl .
   BIND(IRI(REPLACE(?accused, '^(.+)$', ?formatterurl)) AS ?accusedurl).

  ?item wdt:P1595 wd:Q30172593   . 
  ?item wdt:P551 ?residence .
  ?residence wdt:P625 ?coords.
   {?item p:P1595 ?ChargeStatement . 
              ?ChargeStatement ps:P1595 ?charge ; 
                 pq:P4675 ?appears .
            OPTIONAL { ?appears wdt:P18 ?image }  #end time qualifier value .
  SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en".  
                          ?appears rdfs:label ?Appears .
                          ?charge rdfs:label ?chargeLabel .
                          ?residence rdfs:label ?residenceLabel .
                          ?item rdfs:label ?itemLabel .
                          ?accused rdfs:label ?accusedLabel .}
context: Accused witches in Scotland accused of shapeshifting
target: This SPARQL query retrieves information about people (wd:Q5) accused of shapeshifting (property P4478) in Scotland (location Q30172593). query:
#Main Subject bubble chart of Articles in Journals with AJOL ID, published in Ghana, about diseases
#defaultView:BubbleChart
#Author: Silvia Gutiérrez (@espejolento)
SELECT ?mainsubject ?mainsubjectLabel (COUNT(?mainsubject) AS ?count)
WHERE {
  ?article wdt:P31 wd:Q13442814. #scholarly articles
  ?article wdt:P1433 ?item. #published in journal
  ?item wdt:P6183 ?id . #with AJOL ID
  ?item wdt:P495 wd:Q117. #country of journal = Ghana
  ?article wdt:P921 ?mainsubject.
  ?mainsubject wdt:P279 wd:Q12136. #Main Subject is a subclass of a disease
  SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". } 
}
GROUP BY ?mainsubject ?mainsubjectLabel
ORDER BY DESC (?count)
context: Main Subject bubble chart of Articles in Journals with AJOL ID, published in Ghana, about diseases
target: This SPARQL query retrieves and counts scholarly articles published in journals based in Ghana that have an AJOL (African Journals Online) ID. query:
# Histogram of most common journals that have articles about ISS experiment results?
#defaultView:BarChart
SELECT ?q ?qLabel (COUNT(?q) as ?count) WHERE {
  ?item wdt:P31 wd:Q13442814 . 
  ?item wdt:P4510 ?thing .
  ?thing wdt:P31 wd:Q108572660 .
  ?item wdt:P1433 ?q .
  SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
} 
GROUP BY ?q ?qLabel
ORDER BY DESC (?count)
LIMIT 50

context: List of cathedrals around the world with its height
target: This SPARQL query retrieves a list of cathedrals identified by two specific Wikidata IDs. For each cathedral, it fetches its Spanish name, height (if available), and an image (if available). The results are filtered to show only Spanish labels and are ordered by height in descending order, enabling a clear comparison of cathedral heights with visuals.

context: Population of Check villages with rivers flowing through them
target: This SPARQL query retrieves up to five distinct villages (items) classified under a specific category (wd:Q5153359) with populations over 25,000. It excludes villages that have any rivers (wdt:P206) flowing through them. The query also fetches their labels in Czech or English and orders the results by population in descending order, showing the largest such villages without rivers.

context: Ships with multiple operators that do not have multiple official names
target: This SPARQL query retrieves ships (instances of Q161705) that have been operated by more than one distinct operator (P137). It filters out ships that have multiple official names linked to these operators (no multiple name qualifiers with operator). The results list unique ships and their labels, ordered alphabetically, highlighting vessels with multiple operators but a single official name.

context: Map of narrative locations of romantic comedies
target: This SPARQL query retrieves romantic comedy films along with their narrative locations to create a map visualization. It selects distinct films classified as movies (Q11424) in the romantic comedy genre (Q860626), their story settings (?place) with geographic coordinates (?coords), release year, and a related URL if available. Labels are included for readability.

context: Which cathedrals are the tallest in the world?
target: This SPARQL query retrieves cathedrals identified by two specific Wikidata items (Q56242215 and Q56242235). For each cathedral, it fetches its Spanish name (`?nombre`), height in meters (`?altura`), and an image (`?image`) if available. The results are ordered by height in descending order, highlighting the tallest cathedrals first.

context: Interviewees who were part of the Suffragette Movement
target: This SPARQL query retrieves interviews from the LSESuffrageInterviewsProject where the interviewee is also the main subject. It lists each interview (?item) and the associated person (?person) who participated as the interviewee, including their family name if available. Results are ordered alphabetically by family name, with labels shown in the user's language or English.

context: Interviewees who had a relative or friend in the Suffragette Movement
target: This SPARQL query retrieves distinct interviews from the LSESuffrageInterviewsProject where the interviewee participated but is not the main subject. It identifies the interviewee (?person), their family name, and the main subject (?subject), who is a person involved in the Suffragette Movement. The query fetches labels for readability and orders results by family name.

context: Map of every recorded battle the past 4,500 years
target: This SPARQL query retrieves all items classified as battles (including their subclasses) from Wikidata that have geographic coordinates. It selects each battle’s location data to plot them on a map, enabling visualization of every recorded battle over the past 4,500 years based on Wikipedia’s linked data. The `#defaultView:Map` directive displays results as a map.

context: Map of locations of witch memorials and sites of interest in Scotland
target: This SPARQL query retrieves a list of distinct items that are parts of the entity identified by Q123249004 (witch memorials and related sites in Scotland). For each item, it fetches its label, an optional image, geographical coordinates, and the label of its location if available. The query uses Wikibase’s label service to return labels in the user’s language or English, enabling a map visualization of these sites.

context: Articles on English Wikipedia tagged 'Water pollution' with no equivalent article in Spanish
target: This SPARQL query retrieves Wikidata items linked to English Wikipedia articles categorized under "Water pollution" that do not have a corresponding article in Spanish Wikipedia. It fetches each item's Wikidata ID, English label, the English article title, and its URL. This helps identify topics covered in English but missing in Spanish on this environmental issue.

context: Highest point (in meters) per counties in Finland
target: This SPARQL query finds the highest geographical point in each county of Finland. It first calculates the maximum elevation (?height) per county (?county) by examining elevation data (property P2044) for points located within Finnish counties (country Q33). Then, it retrieves the specific points matching these maximum heights, along with their labels and county names, providing a clear list of each county’s tallest point.

context: Week 46, 2023: Top album languages found on Wikidata right now
target: This SPARQL query counts how many albums (items classified as Q482994) exist for each language (property P407) in Wikidata. It groups albums by their language, including those without a specified language, then orders the results by the number of albums in descending order. Labels for languages are fetched in the user's preferred language for readability.

context: Week 47, 2023: Top album languages found on Wikidata right now
target: This SPARQL query counts the number of music albums (instances of Q482994) grouped by their language of publication (property P407). It lists each language alongside the total albums available in that language, sorting the results from the most to the fewest albums. The query also fetches human-readable language labels for clarity.

context: Gender representation of Scottish witches
target: This SPARQL query retrieves data about Scottish witches, including their names, residences, and geographic coordinates. It also captures their gender, if known, and assigns a color code: blue for males, red for females, and green if gender is unspecified. The results include labels and coordinates, enabling visualization on a map with gender-based color layers.

context: Most popular names in Ghana among Ghanaians on Wikidata
target: This SPARQL query identifies the 50 most popular first names among Ghanaians on Wikidata. It selects people with Ghanaian citizenship (wdt:P27 wd:Q117) and retrieves their first names (wdt:P735). It counts how often each name appears, grouping results by the name’s entity and English label. Results are ordered by popularity, showing the most common Ghanaian first names.

context: People born somewhere named after them
target: This SPARQL query finds people born in places named after them. It retrieves each person’s name, birth and death dates (if available), their birthplace, and the country of that place. The query links a person’s birthplace to a place that shares their name, highlighting cases where locations are named in honor of their native individuals.

context: Rose cultivars named after screen writers
target: This SPARQL query retrieves rose cultivars named after screenwriters. It selects items classified as rose cultivars (wd:Q26817508) linked to a person (?person) who is a screenwriter (wd:Q28389). For each screenwriter, it optionally fetches their date of birth and death, along with labels for both the rose cultivar and the person, supporting multiple languages.

context: Geolocalized object that have the same name than something named after some some kind of church building
target: This SPARQL query retrieves geolocated items sharing names with entities related to a specific type of church building (Q16970). It filters out disambiguation pages and gathers each item's label, image, coordinates, and nature (type) labels. Results are grouped by item, enabling display on a map with layers named after their nature, showing clustered info like images and coordinates.

query:
#title:Timeline of games per platform
#defaultView:AreaChart
SELECT (SAMPLE(?year) AS ?year) (COUNT(?_platform) AS ?count) (SAMPLE(?_platformLabel) AS ?platformLabel)  WHERE {
  ?video_game wdt:P31 wd:Q7889.
  ?video_game wdt:P400 ?_platform.
  ?video_game wdt:P577 ?date.
  BIND ( STR(year(?date)) as ?year )
  FILTER(BOUND(?year))
  SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en".
                          ?_platform rdfs:label ?_platformLabel.}
}
GROUP BY ?year ?_platform
HAVING (?count > 100)
context: Video games per Platform
target: This SPARQL query retrieves the number of video games released each year on different platforms, focusing only on platforms with over 100 games in a given year. It selects video games (wd:Q7889), extracts their release year and platform, groups the data by year and platform, and fetches platform labels for readability. The result is suited for an area chart showing game release trends per platform over time.

context: List of movies directed by French filmmakers born after 1930 with or without Depardieu
target: This SPARQL query retrieves distinct French filmmakers born after 1930 who have directed movies. For each filmmaker, it gets their name, gender, and the movies they've directed. It also checks if actor Gérard Depardieu (wd:Q106508) appears in the movie’s cast, marking this with a boolean flag. Labels are filtered to the user’s language.

context: Czech buildings carved into the rock
target: This SPARQL query retrieves Czech buildings carved into rock. It selects items classified as instances or subclasses of "rock-cut building" (Q11587139), located in the Czech Republic (Q213), and having geographic coordinates (P625). The query also fetches labels in Czech or English, enabling map visualization of these unique architectural sites.

query:
#defaultView:Map
SELECT DISTINCT ?stadLabel ?itemLabel  ?spoor ?layer ?geo ?article WHERE {
  ?item wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q15640053 .
  ?item wdt:P17 wd:Q183 .
  ?item wdt:P131 ?stad.
  ?stad wdt:P625 ?geo.
  ?item wdt:P1064 ?spoorbreedte.
  ?spoorbreedte wdt:P2049 ?spoor.
  FILTER NOT EXISTS { ?item wdt:P3999 [] } .
  FILTER NOT EXISTS { ?item wdt:P5817 wd:Q11639308 }
  BIND(
    IF(?spoor < 1435, "smalspoor",
    IF(?spoor = 1435, "normaalspoor",
    "breedspoor"))
    AS ?layer).
  SERVICE wikibase:label {
    bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "de" .
  }
  OPTIONAL {
      ?article schema:about ?item .
      ?article schema:inLanguage "de" .
      FILTER (SUBSTR(str(?article), 1, 25) = "https://de.wikipedia.org/")
  }
}
context: Distribution of the different tram gauges in Germany
target: This SPARQL query retrieves distinct tram systems in Germany, identifying their city, tram gauge width, and geographic location. It filters out entries with certain disqualifying properties, then classifies each tram gauge as narrow, standard, or broad gauge. The query also fetches German labels and links to related German Wikipedia articles, enabling a map-based visualization of tram gauge distribution across German cities.

context: Scale of stampedes reported on Wikidata
target: This SPARQL query retrieves data on stampedes recorded in Wikidata, focusing on incidents categorized as crushes or crowd disasters. It fetches details like date, location, number of deaths and injuries, and images of the places involved. The query groups events into layers based on death tolls (e.g., "More than 100 deaths") to enable visualization by severity, ordered by highest fatalities first.

context: Visual artists whose works will enter the Public Domain in Mexico on January 1, 2024
target: This SPARQL query retrieves visual artists whose works entered the Public Domain in Mexico on January 1, 2024. It selects distinct artists classified as visual artists (including subclasses), filters those who died in 1923 (since Mexico’s copyright term is life plus 100 years), and returns their names, number of Wikipedia sitelinks, and death year. Results are ordered by popularity.

context: Top music album languages found on Wikidata right now
target: This SPARQL query counts music albums (instances of Q482994) grouped by their language of publication (property P407) and lists these languages in descending order of album count. It uses a subquery to aggregate album counts per language, includes labels for readability, and orders results by the number of albums, showing which languages dominate in music album metadata on Wikidata.

query:
#defaultView:Timeline
SELECT ?composer ?composerLabel ?dateOD ?placeODLabel (SAMPLE(?img) AS ?image) (COUNT(?work) as ?CW)
WHERE {
  ?work wdt:P86 ?composer .                 # wdt:P86 composer
  ?composer wdt:P570 ?dateOD ;              # wdt:P570 date of death (Monteverdi died in 1643)
            wdt:P20 ?placeOD                # wdt:P20 place of death
            FILTER(YEAR(?dateOD) > 1000 
                   && YEAR(?dateOD) < 1644) . 
  ?placeOD wdt:P17 ?country .
  # positive list is ugly, I don't know better yet.
  VALUES ?countries {
      wd:Q28 wd:Q29 wd:Q31 wd:Q34 wd:Q36 wd:Q38 wd:Q39 wd:Q40 wd:Q41 wd:Q45 wd:Q55 wd:Q142 wd:Q145 wd:Q183 wd:Q212 wd:Q213 wd:Q219 wd:Q38872
      #  Mexico https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaspar_Fernandes, currently only one of his works is registered, so having CW>1 will loose him
      wd:Q96 } .
  FILTER(?country IN (?countries)) .
  OPTIONAL { ?composer wdt:P18 ?img . }     # wdt:P18 image
  SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". }
}
GROUP BY ?composer ?composerLabel ?dateOD ?placeODLabel
HAVING (?CW >= 2)
LIMIT 180
context: Western composers until the end of the Renaissance
target: This SPARQL query retrieves Western composers who died between the years 1001 and 1643, focusing on those with at least two known works. It gathers each composer's name, date and place of death (limited to specific countries), and an optional image. The results help visualize Renaissance-era composers’ timelines and geographic details, highlighting their cultural context.

context: Average age of supporters of Gérard Depardieu
target: This SPARQL query calculates the average age of people who signed a document supporting Gérard Depardieu. It finds the publication date of the document (wd:Q124005357), retrieves each signatory’s birth date, computes their age at the time of publication, and then averages these ages to give the mean supporter age.

This SPARQL query retrieves railway stations in metropolitan France, focusing on their operational status. It selects stations of specific types (like running or out-of-service), fetches their coordinates for mapping, and optionally includes a color code representing their usage state. The result enables visualizing these stations on a map with labels and colored layers indicating their condition.

query:
#defaultView:Map
SELECT distinct ?item ?itemLabel ?img ?coord
WHERE 
{
  ?item wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q12280.
  ?item wdt:P18 ?img.
  ?item wdt:P17 wd:Q145.
  ?item wdt:P625 ?coord. 
  {?item wdt:P131/wdt:P131* wd:Q21 . hint:Prior hint:gearing "forward".} UNION
  {?item wdt:P131/wdt:P131* wd:Q22 . hint:Prior hint:gearing "forward".} UNION
  {?item wdt:P131/wdt:P131* wd:Q25 . hint:Prior hint:gearing "forward".} UNION
  {?item wdt:P131/wdt:P131* wd:Q26 . hint:Prior hint:gearing "forward".}
  SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". } 
  
}
context: Bridges in the UK with photos
target: This SPARQL query retrieves distinct bridges located in the UK, specifically within England, Scotland, Wales, or Northern Ireland. For each bridge, it fetches its name, an image, and geographic coordinates. It uses subclass relationships to include all types of bridges, filters by country (UK), and limits results to certain administrative regions, returning data ready for mapping or visualization.

context: Programming languages influenced by Niklaus Wirth (directly or indirectly)
target: This SPARQL query retrieves programming languages influenced by Niklaus Wirth, either directly or through a chain of influences. It selects entities classified as programming languages (`wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q9143`) that have one or more relationships indicating influence (`wdt:P737`, `wdt:P144`, or `wdt:P287`) linked to Niklaus Wirth (`wd:Q92604`). The results include labels and descriptions, sorted by the number of Wikipedia sitelinks as a popularity measure.

context: Historical events by a city sorted by importance
target: This SPARQL query retrieves distinct items representing historical events associated with either the city of London (Q84) or the London Borough of Camden (Q23306). It filters items classified as instances or subclasses of "historical event" (Q1190554). For each event, it fetches the item’s label and the number of Wikipedia sitelinks, ordering results by the highest number of sitelinks to highlight the most notable events.

query:
#Bubble chart showing number of out of school children per country in 2013
#defaultView:BubbleChart
SELECT DISTINCT ?country ?countryLabel ?number_of_out_of_school_chidren ?date ?methodLabel
WHERE {
  ?country wdt:P31 wd:Q6256 .
  ?country p:P2573 ?out_of_school_chidren .
  ?out_of_school_chidren ps:P2573 ?number_of_out_of_school_chidren .
  ?out_of_school_chidren pq:P585 ?date .
  ?out_of_school_chidren pq:P459 ?method .
  
  FILTER (year(?date) = 2013)
  
  SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
  
} 

ORDER BY DESC (?number_of_out_of_school_chidren)
context: Bubble chart showing countries with the highest number of children out of school in 2013
target: This SPARQL query retrieves data on the number of out-of-school children per country for the year 2013. It selects countries, their labels, the count of out-of-school children, the date of the data, and the method used to gather it. The results are ordered from highest to lowest, enabling a bubble chart visualization highlighting countries with the largest numbers in 2013.

context: Timeline of writing systems and alphabets
target: This SPARQL query retrieves a timeline of writing systems and alphabets from Wikidata. It selects distinct authors (writing systems or alphabets), their labels, images (if available), and their inception dates. It filters items classified as writing systems (Q8192) or their subclasses, ensuring each has a known start date. Labels are fetched in multiple languages for broader accessibility.

query:
#defaultView:Map
SELECT distinct ?item ?itemLabel ?pobLabel (ROUND(?dist) as ?distance) ?coord ?coord2 ?line
WHERE 
{
  ?item wdt:P39 ?position.
  wd:Q112014 wdt:P2670 ?position.
  ?item p:P39 ?stat . 
  ?stat ps:P39 ?position . 
  filter not exists {?stat pq:P582 [] .}
  SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". } 
  ?item wdt:P39 wd:Q77685926 .
  ?item wdt:P19 ?pob .
  ?pob wdt:P625 ?coord . 
  wd:Q62408 wdt:P625 ?coord2 .
  BIND(geof:distance(?coord, ?coord2) as ?dist) 
  
  ?pob p:P625 [ ps:P625 [];  psv:P625 [ wikibase:geoLongitude ?coord1lon; wikibase:geoLatitude ?coord1lat; ] ].
  wd:Q62408 p:P625 [ ps:P625 [];  psv:P625 [ wikibase:geoLongitude ?coord2lon; wikibase:geoLatitude ?coord2lat; ] ].
  BIND(CONCAT('LINESTRING (', STR(?coord1lon), ' ', STR(?coord1lat), ',', STR(?coord2lon), ' ', STR(?coord2lat), ')') AS ?str) .
  BIND(STRDT(?str, geo:wktLiteral) AS ?line)  
} order by ?distance
context: Distance between the birthplace of UK ministers and London
target: This SPARQL query finds UK ministers currently holding a specific office (position Q77685926) whose birthplace is known. It calculates the geographic distance between each minister’s birthplace and London (Q62408). The query returns each minister’s item, position label, birthplace label, distance (rounded), coordinates, and a WKT line representing the direct path from birthplace to London, ordered by proximity.

context: The 100 smallest mountains in France
target: This SPARQL query retrieves the 100 smallest mountains located in France by their elevation. It selects items classified as mountains (or subclasses), filters those within France, and extracts their elevation values along with units. The query converts all elevations to meters for consistent comparison, orders the results by height ascendingly, and returns the mountain’s name, elevation, and unit details.

context: French Prime ministers ordered by age when they start in office
target: This SPARQL query retrieves French Prime Ministers, listing each person’s name, term start and end dates, and their age at the start of their term. It finds items with the position "Prime Minister of France" (Q1587677), gets their birthdate and term start (and optionally end) dates, calculates their age at term start by subtracting birthdate from start date, and orders the results by this age.

context: Projects with which New Zealand Thesis people overlap
target: This SPARQL query identifies projects linked to people classified as "New Zealand Thesis" (wd:Q111645234) who are associated with multiple projects. First, it finds individuals (wd:Q5) connected to more than one such project. Then, it counts how many of these individuals are linked to other projects (excluding the original New Zealand Thesis project). Finally, it lists these projects with their labels, ordered by how many overlapping individuals they share.

context: Most articles about films in each Wikipedia
target: This SPARQL query finds the top 10 Wikipedias by the number of distinct film articles they contain. It first counts how many unique films have articles in each language Wikipedia, then retrieves the English name of each Wikipedia edition. Finally, it lists these Wikipedias with their film article counts, ordered from highest to lowest.

context: Map of items next to the Seine
target: This SPARQL query retrieves places located along the Seine River (wd:Q1471) that have geographic coordinates (wdt:P625). For each place (?item), it fetches its French label (?itemLabel) and coordinates (?coord). The results can be visualized on a map, highlighting locations bathed by the Seine with French names.

context: 300 most followed Mastodon accounts
target: This SPARQL query retrieves the 300 Mastodon accounts with the highest follower counts, showing each account’s address and follower number. It selects only the most recent follower data by filtering out older records, ensuring up-to-date follower counts. Results are ordered from most to fewer followers, ideal for visualizing popular Mastodon accounts.

context: Hospitals across Scotland
target: This SPARQL query retrieves information about hospitals in Scotland. It selects distinct hospital entities (?hosp) along with their labels, the related items (?item) and their labels, the number of hospital beds (?hbeds), optional geographic coordinates (?loc), and optional images (?himg). The query filters items classified under a specific category (wd:Q83425186) and links them to hospitals with bed counts, providing a dataset ideal for mapping and visualization.

context: People educated at the University of Leeds with a Wikipedia article
target: This SPARQL query retrieves people affiliated with the University of Leeds, specifically those educated there (property P69). For each person, it fetches their name, description, number of Wikipedia sitelinks, and the URL of their English Wikipedia article. Results are sorted by popularity, showing the most linked individuals first.

context: Properties for UK lakes
target: This SPARQL query lists properties used to describe UK lakes (items instance of lake or its subclasses, located in the UK). For each property, it counts how many distinct lakes have that property, orders properties by usage frequency, and fetches their English labels. It also generates a URL linking to a detailed query showing all lake values for that property, enabling deeper exploration.

query:
#title: 10 most famous places in New Dehli (measured by sitelinks)
#defaultView:Map
SELECT ?place ?placeLabel ?sitelinks ?coord ?article (SAMPLE(?image) as ?sample_image) 
WHERE
{
  ?place wdt:P131 wd:Q1353 . 
  ?place wikibase:sitelinks ?sitelinks . 
  ?place wdt:P18 ?image . 
  ?place wdt:P625 ?coord . 
  ?article schema:about ?place .
  ?article schema:inLanguage "en" .
  ?article schema:isPartOf <https://en.wikipedia.org/> .

  # The bit below is needed to exclude the Aravalli Range 
  wd:Q1353 wdt:P625 ?loc .
  SERVICE wikibase:around {
      ?place wdt:P625 ?location .
      bd:serviceParam wikibase:center ?loc .
      bd:serviceParam wikibase:radius "50" .
  }
  SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
}
GROUP BY ?place ?placeLabel ?sitelinks ?coord ?article 
ORDER BY DESC(?sitelinks)
LIMIT 10
context: 10 most famous places in New Dehli (measured by Sitelinks)
target: This SPARQL query retrieves the top 10 most famous places within a 50 km radius of New Delhi (wd:Q1353), ranked by the number of Wikipedia sitelinks—a measure of their global notability. For each place, it fetches the name, coordinates, an English Wikipedia article, and an image. The results are grouped and displayed on a map for easy visualization.

context: Map of objects on the banks of the Kama and the rivers flowing into it
target: This SPARQL query retrieves geographic data for mapping objects located on the banks of the Kama River (wd:Q79082) and its tributaries. It selects items directly situated on the Kama with coordinates, as well as those associated with the Kama via a specific route (wdt:P403) that have coordinates tagged with a qualifier indicating the location context (wd:Q1233637). The query also fetches labels in the user's language for display on a map.

context: Duration of Wikimedia residencies (the average duration is 11 months)
target: This SPARQL query retrieves data about people who held the occupation "Wikimedia resident" (Q3809586). For each residency, it fetches the employer, start and end dates, and calculates the duration in months when possible. It also gathers related links and labels, organizing results by the most recent end date. This helps analyze residency lengths, comparing them to the average 11 months.

context: Real numbers with their approximate value
target: This SPARQL query retrieves real numbers from Wikidata (entities that are instances of the class "real number" - Q12916). For each real number, it optionally fetches its approximate numeric value (property P1181). The results include the real number’s label in English and its value, sorted in descending order by the value. This helps list real numbers along with their approximate values.

context: exploratory query to find new items
target: This SPARQL query retrieves items (?obiekt) linked to people (?osoba) associated with a specific organization (wd:Q210431). It finds objects connected via properties P547 (dedicated to) or P138 (named after), ensures these people belong to or are part of the organization (P102 or P361), and gets the objects’ geographic coordinates (P625). Optionally, it fetches the city (?miasto) containing the object. Labels are returned in the user’s language or Polish. This helps explore new items related to members of that organization.

context: Exploring Wikidata Items for people born in the Basque country
target: This SPARQL query retrieves Basque-born women from Wikidata who have articles on the Basque Wikipedia. It finds female individuals (P21 = female) connected to the Basque Country (Q47588) via their place of birth (P19) or related locations. For each, it gets their birthplace coordinates (P625) and labels, enabling mapping of these notable women geographically.

context: Birthplace of Colombians in the Public Domain
target: This SPARQL query retrieves Colombian creators whose works are in the public domain. For each person, it fetches their name, birthplace, and the geographical coordinates of that birthplace. The results can be visualized on a map, showing where these notable Colombian creators were born. This helps explore cultural heritage linked to specific locations in Colombia.

context: Relationship between Institutions, Works and Persons in the Colombian Public Domain
target: This SPARQL query retrieves up to 200 persons associated with Colombia (country code Q739) who are linked to a specific institution (Q71887839). For each person, it fetches their name, any notable works they created, and works of theirs held in the institution’s collection. Labels are included for readability, providing insight into the relationship between individuals, their creations, and the institution’s holdings.

context: Graph of all individuals connected to the Suffrage Interviews and institutions holding their oral history
target: This SPARQL query retrieves a list of people linked to the Suffrage Interviews (wd:Q117322976) from Wikidata. For each individual (instance of a human), it fetches their name, image (if available), and the institution holding their oral history recordings, along with that institution’s name and image. Labels are returned in the user’s language or English.

context: List of masters theses written in Māori
target: This SPARQL query retrieves a list of master's theses written in the Māori language. It selects items classified as master's theses (wd:Q1907875) with the language set to Māori (wd:Q36451). For each thesis, it fetches the title, author(s), affiliated university, and publication year. Optional data like university and author names are included if available. Results are sorted by year.

context: Tram systems with 1435mm wide rails
target: This SPARQL query retrieves active tram systems that use the standard gauge track width of 1435mm. It selects tram systems identified as such (wd:Q15640053) and filters those with the standard gauge property (wd:Q1999572). For each, it fetches their geographic coordinates and labels, enabling mapping of these tram networks worldwide.

context: Remakes of Soviet films with their popularity
target: This SPARQL query retrieves Soviet films (instance of "film" with country of origin Russia) along with their release years and the number of Wikipedia sitelinks (a popularity metric). It also finds remakes of these films, including their release years and sitelinks. Labels for films and remakes are fetched in the user's language or English, enabling comparison of original Soviet films and their remakes by popularity and release date.

context: Images for all monuments with a Bavarian monument authority ID in Passau administrative district
target: This SPARQL query retrieves images of monuments located in the Passau administrative district that have a Bavarian monument authority ID. It first selects monuments with their German labels and geographic coordinates, then finds images depicting these monuments. The result lists each monument’s ID, German name, image, and coordinates, enabling visualization of Passau’s officially registered monuments.

context: Most frequent objects depicted on coats of arms
target: This SPARQL query retrieves coats of arms (entities classified as "coat of arms" - Q14659) along with their associated images. It selects items that are instances of coats of arms (P31 = Q14659) and have an image property (P18). The results can be displayed as an image grid, showcasing visual examples of coats of arms.

context: Tolkien-style plurals
target: This SPARQL query finds English nouns in Wikidata that end with "f" in singular form and "fs" in plural form—like "leaf" and "leafs"—and generates Tolkien-style plurals by replacing "f"/"fs" with "ve"/"ves" (e.g., "leaves"). It then filters out any lexemes that already have this Tolkien plural recorded, highlighting missing or nonstandard plural forms inspired by Tolkien’s usage.

context: Lexemes with a Sense related to a geolocated Item
target: This SPARQL query retrieves lexemes (words) linked to geographic locations. For each lexeme, it fetches the lemma (base form), the language label, and the coordinates of the related place. It uses the `ontolex:sense` property to connect lexemes to senses tied to geolocated items, extracting their coordinates (P625) and displaying language names for clarity.

context: Map of all places related to persons with layers by property of the place
target: This SPARQL query finds distinct people connected to Germany (wd:Q11943) through various place-related properties like birthplace, death place, residence, place of work, or citizenship. For each person, it retrieves the associated place’s coordinates and labels, categorizing them into layers such as "Geburtsort" (birthplace) or "Sterbeort" (death place). The results enable mapping these places with labeled layers on a map.

context: Map of river names in german coloured by gender
target: This SPARQL query retrieves German river names along with their grammatical gender and geographic coordinates or shapes. It selects lexical entries in German classified as nouns, linking each to its gender and corresponding river entity. The query also assigns specific colors to genders for map visualization, enabling a map view that displays rivers colored by their grammatical gender.

context: World map of subway maps
target: This SPARQL query retrieves subway systems from Wikidata that belong to specific types (Q5503, Q1268865, Q113455515), are located in a particular city (Q55654238), and have geographic coordinates. It fetches their labels in French and optionally includes related subway map images. The results are grouped by subway system, label, and coordinates, ideal for plotting subway locations on a world map.

context: View of the associative network of artists to societies
target: This SPARQL query retrieves distinct artists linked to multiple specific Scottish art societies (from a predefined list). It counts how many societies each artist belongs to, filters for those associated with more than one, and returns the artist, the societies they belong to, their labels, and a fixed RGB color code ("99ffeb"). This helps visualize artists' memberships across these art groups.

context: Two or more statements on a certain property
target: This SPARQL query finds all items that have at least two distinct, non-deprecated statements for the property P10565. It ensures both statements are valid by filtering out any with a deprecated rank. Essentially, it identifies items with multiple active claims on the same property, useful for spotting conflicting or diverse data entries.

query:
#defaultView:Map
#Fimmakers
SELECT DISTINCT ?filmmaker ?filmmakerLabel ?lugar ?coord ?birthdate ?year ?TabakaleraURL ("this is a link " as ?TabakaleraURLLabel)
 
WHERE
{
  ?filmmaker wdt:P31 wd:Q5 ;
             wdt:P106 wd:Q2526255 ; #zinemagilea
             wdt:P19 ?lugar ;
             wdt:P1344 wd:Q9081343.
  ?lugar wdt:P625 ?coord.
 
  
  OPTIONAL{ ?filmmaker wdt:P569 ?birthdate . } # P569 : Date de naissance
  BIND(year(?birthdate) as ?year)
  FILTER(?year > 1800)
  
  ?filmmaker  wdt:P10069  ?tabakalera.
  wd:P10069 wdt:P1630 ?formatterurl .
  BIND(IRI(REPLACE(?tabakalera, '^(.+)$', ?formatterurl)) AS ?TabakaleraURL).

  SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
 
}
context: Explore data about Tabakalera participants
target: This SPARQL query retrieves distinct filmmakers linked to Tabakalera, a cultural center. It selects filmmakers (humans, profession: filmmaker) born after 1800, their birthplaces with coordinates, birthdates, and the year of birth. It also constructs a clickable Tabakalera URL for each filmmaker. The query uses Wikidata labels for readability and displays results on a map.

context: Mothers on Wikidata
target: This SPARQL query retrieves up to 1000 unique mother-child pairs from Wikidata, focusing on humans (Q5). It finds each mother's and child's birth dates, calculates the mother's age at the child's birth in years, and returns their Wikidata IDs and labels. Results are ordered by the mother's age at childbirth, from youngest to oldest.

query:
SELECT ?univ ?univLabel ?debut ?fin ?president ?presidentLabel ?naissance ?deces ?age ?sexeLabel ?roleLabel ?motifLabel 
WHERE {
  SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "fr". }
  
  ?univ wdt:P31 wd:Q3551775 . # université de France
  ?univ p:P488 ?node .        # récupère tous les présidents et pas seulement le dernier
  ?node ps:P488 ?president . 
  OPTIONAL {?node pq:P1534 ?motif.}
  OPTIONAL {?node pq:P39 ?role.}
  
  OPTIONAL{?node pq:P580 ?année .} # date de début du mandat
  OPTIONAL{?node pq:P582 ?année2 .} # date de fin du mandat
  OPTIONAL{?president wdt:P569 ?année3 .} # année de naissance
  OPTIONAL{?president wdt:P570 ?année4 .} # année de décès
  OPTIONAL{?president wdt:P21 ?sexe.} # sexe du président
  
  BIND(year(?année) as ?debut) # conserve que l'année
  BIND(year(?année2) as ?fin)
  BIND(year(?année3) as ?naissance)
  BIND(year(?année4) as ?deces)
  BIND(?debut - ?naissance AS ?age) # âge en début de mandat
}

ORDER BY ?univLabel ?debut
context: Presidents of French Universities
target: This SPARQL query retrieves detailed information about all presidents of French universities (instances of "université de France"). For each university, it lists every president's name, their term start and end years, birth and death years, gender, role, and reason for appointment if available. It also calculates the president’s age at the start of their mandate, ordering results by university and term start year.

This SPARQL query retrieves distinct lists of ambassadors categorized by their sending (operator) and hosting countries. It selects entities that are parts of a broader category related to ambassadors (Q121998), linking each list to its sending country (?opérateur) and hosting country (?hôte_host), both confirmed as countries. It also optionally includes any opposing or related entities (?contraire). Results are labeled in multiple languages and ordered by sending country, hosting country, then list name.

This SPARQL query retrieves a list of current embassies, detailing the embassy entity, the country operating it, the host country, and optionally, the counterpart entity involved. It filters for embassies (instances or subclasses of embassies), active as of a specific time, where both operating and host countries are recognized sovereign states. Labels are fetched in the user's language for readability, and results are ordered by operator and host country names.

context: Images of types of dance in the world
target: This SPARQL query retrieves various types of dances (instances of the dance class) from Wikidata. For each dance, it fetches an image, a name, and the country of origin, if available. The query also uses the label service to get readable country names in the user's language or English. Results are suited for displaying as an image grid of global dance styles.

context: Indigenous Performers Arts Alliance (IPAA) Members living, working or from Canada
target: This SPARQL query retrieves members of the Indigenous Performers Arts Alliance (IPAA) who are connected to Canada—either born there, living there, or working there. For each member, it fetches their name, description, number of Wikipedia sitelinks, and labels for their birthplace, workplace, and residence if available. Results are sorted by popularity (sitelinks) and name.

query:
#defaultView:Map
SELECT ?label ?coord ?subj
WHERE
{
   ?subj wdt:P170 wd:Q5593 .
  OPTIONAL {?subj wdt:P276 ?loc .
    ?loc wdt:P625 ?coord } .
   ?subj rdfs:label ?label FILTER (lang(?label) = "en")
}
context: A map with locations of Pablo Picasso works
target: This SPARQL query retrieves English labels and geographic coordinates for artworks created by Pablo Picasso (wd:Q5593). It selects each artwork (?subj) with Picasso as the creator (wdt:P170), optionally finds its location (?loc) and coordinates (?coord), and returns the artwork’s name (?label), its coordinates, and the artwork’s identifier. The results can be visualized on a map.

context: Descendants of King Antso III
target: This SPARQL query finds individuals up to four steps away in the family tree from King Antso III (wd:Q296652) by following "child" relationships (property P40). It uses a graph analytics service to perform a shortest path search forward through descendants. For each person found, it retrieves their name, picture (P18), and links to their children, providing a snapshot of King Antso III’s descendants with images and family connections.

context: Birthplace of French Heads of State
target: This SPARQL query retrieves French Heads of State (or related positions) along with their parents and the parents' birthplaces. It selects each leader (?item) holding a role linked to Q111840950, then finds their father (P22) or mother (P25). For each parent, it fetches birth coordinates (P19 birthplace with geocoordinates P625). Labels and locations are included for mapping.

context: Films starring Cary Grant, directed by Howard Hughes, available on YouTube
target: This SPARQL query retrieves English-language films starring Cary Grant and directed by Howard Hawks. For each film, it fetches the release date, title, and constructs a YouTube URL using the film’s associated YouTube video ID. The results are ordered chronologically by release date, helping to explore Cary Grant’s collaborations with Howard Hawks available on YouTube.

query:
# Mountains over 7000 m
SELECT DISTINCT ?item ?itemLabel ?alt ?coord
 WHERE {
   ?item wdt:P31 wd:Q8502.
   ?item p:P2044  ?salt.
               ?salt psn:P2044  ?saltn.
                ?saltn wikibase:quantityAmount ?alt. 
   ?item wdt:P625 ?coord.
   FILTER(?alt > 7000)
   SERVICE wikibase:label {bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],ca,en,es,fr".}   
}
ORDER BY DESC(?alt)
#defaultView:Map
context: Mountains with a height over 7000m
target: This SPARQL query retrieves mountains taller than 7000 meters from Wikidata. It selects each mountain’s item ID, label (name), altitude, and coordinates. The query filters entities classified as mountains (wd:Q8502) and extracts their elevation (property P2044) to include only those above 7000 meters. Results are ordered by descending height and include multilingual labels, displayed on a map by default.

context: Find Items that share an Identifier
target: This SPARQL query finds identifiers (`?idnt`) linked to more than one distinct item (`?item`) in Wikidata. It first counts how many items share each identifier, then selects those identifiers with multiple items. Finally, it retrieves each item and its label, showing cases where the same identifier is associated with multiple entities—useful for spotting duplicates or shared references.

context: Who has worked with this Celebrity?
target: This SPARQL query finds all people who have worked with a specific celebrity (identified by Q220308) on any work, such as movies or shows. It first selects works involving the celebrity as an actor (P161) or voice actor (P725), then retrieves other coworkers linked to those same works. The query returns each coworker and the work they collaborated on, including labels in the preferred language.

context: Timeline of inception of Ghanaian universities
target: This SPARQL query retrieves a timeline of universities in Ghana by selecting each university’s entity, its English label, and its founding date. It filters entities that are universities (instance of “university”) located in Ghana (country code Q117) and have a recorded inception date (P571). The results help visualize when Ghanaian universities were established.

context: Tool Registry for Digital Humanities
target: This SPARQL query retrieves digital humanities methods and their associated software tools from Wikidata. It selects methods identified by TaDiRAH IDs, assigns them a color for graph visualization, and finds tools that use these methods, filtering for software items. The query fetches labels, descriptions, and images (like logos) for tools, enabling a rich, visual graph display of methods and tools in the Digital Humanities Tool Registry.

context: Operas ordered by First Performance
target: This SPARQL query retrieves a list of operas (wd:Q1344) along with their world premiere dates, languages, and composers. It groups composers per opera, showing their Wikidata Q-numbers (without the URL prefix) and English labels. The results are ordered by the earliest premiere date, providing a clear timeline of operas and their creators.

context: Performing Arts Productions with a Composer property
target: This SPARQL query retrieves unique performing arts productions (items instance of or subclass of Q43099500) that have a composer (property P86). For each production, it fetches a label in the user's language or falls back to any available label. The result lists each production with a representative label, helping identify works linked to composers in Wikidata.

context: Number of solar eclipses per decades
target: This SPARQL query counts the number of distinct solar eclipses per decade. It selects eclipses (items classified as solar eclipses) with their dates, extracts the year, converts it to the corresponding decade by dividing by 10 and multiplying by 10, then groups and counts these eclipses by decade. The result shows how many solar eclipses occurred in each decade.

context: Longest gap between original film and remake (without any intermediate remakes)
target: This SPARQL query finds film remakes and their original films, retrieving only the earliest remake for each original. It selects remakes classified as films, linked to their original films, and filters out any remakes released earlier than the chosen one. The results show the original and remake titles with their release dates, ordered by the longest gap between original and remake, highlighting remakes with the greatest time difference.

context: Number of people who are both politicians and musicians by political spectrum
target: This SPARQL query retrieves the count of individuals who are both politicians and musicians, grouped by their political spectrum. It looks for people with occupations linked to "musician" (wd:Q639669) and "politician" (wd:Q82955), then finds their political party's spectrum (wdt:P102/wdt:P1387). The results show how many such multi-talented individuals align with each political ideology, sorted from most to least.

query:
SELECT
  ?language
  ?languageLabel
  (COUNT(DISTINCT ?lexeme) AS ?count)

WHERE {
  # Languages of Indonesia.
  wd:Q252 wdt:P2936 ?language.
  
  # Exclude English, Arabic, and Mandarin.
  FILTER(?language != wd:Q1860 && ?language != wd:Q13955 && ?language != wd:Q727694)
  
  # Lexemes of those languages.
  ?lexeme dct:language ?language .

  SERVICE wikibase:label {
    bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE]" .
  }
}

GROUP by ?language ?languageLabel

ORDER BY DESC(?count)
context: Lexeme coverage of Indonesian languages
target: This SPARQL query retrieves languages spoken in Indonesia (excluding English, Arabic, and Mandarin) and counts the number of distinct lexemes documented for each. It groups results by language and sorts them by lexeme count in descending order, showing which Indonesian languages have the most lexeme coverage in the dataset, along with their labels for easy identification.

context: UK MPs and their office start/end years
target: This SPARQL query retrieves UK Members of Parliament (MPs) who have held the office of "Member of the House of Commons" (wd:Q14211). For each MP, it fetches their birth date, the start and optional end dates of their parliamentary term, and calculates their age at the beginning and end of that term. Results are ordered by the term start date, newest first, with labels in the user's language.

query:
# # # generate cumulative experience for all members on a given day

SELECT DISTINCT ?electionday (sum(?experience_in_days) as ?total_experience) (count(distinct ?item) as ?mps)
((sum(?experience_in_days)/(count(distinct ?item))/365.25) as ?average_years)
where 
{  
  ?election wdt:P31 wd:Q15283424 . ?election wdt:P585 ?electionday . filter(year(?electionday) > 1918) .
  ?item p:P39 ?positionStatement . ?positionStatement ps:P39 ?term . ?term wdt:P279 wd:Q16707842 .
  ?positionStatement pq:P580 ?start . ?positionStatement pq:P2715 ?election . # find every MP returned in that election
  optional { select ?item (sum(round(?duration)) as ?experience_in_days) ?electionday
    WHERE 
     { 
       ?election wdt:P31 wd:Q15283424 . ?election wdt:P585 ?electionday . filter(year(?electionday) > 1918) . 
       ?item p:P39 ?ps . ?ps ps:P39 ?term . ?term wdt:P279 wd:Q16707842 . 
       ?ps pq:P580 ?start . ?ps pq:P582 ?end . # only looking at ended terms
       filter ( ?end < ?electionday ) . 
      BIND((?end - ?start) AS ?duration) . 
      # period for all previous terms
   } group by ?item ?electionday
 }  
  
} group by ?electionday order by ?electionday
context: Cumulative experience of UK MPs on election day (since 1922)
target: This SPARQL query calculates the cumulative parliamentary experience of UK MPs on each election day since 1919. For every election, it sums the total days of prior completed terms served by all MPs elected that day, counts the distinct MPs, and computes their average experience in years. This helps analyze how experienced the elected parliament was over time.

context: Location of GLAMs with open access policies
target: This SPARQL query retrieves cultural institutions (GLAMs) that have open access policies (property P1343 with value Q73357989). The results help visualize these GLAMs on a map, highlighting their open access status.

context: Arabic periodicals known to Wikidata
target: This SPARQL query retrieves Arabic-language periodicals published before 1930 from Wikidata, along with their holding institutions. context: X account of politicians
target: This SPARQL query retrieves a list of politicians who have Twitter accounts. It selects each person’s name, their Twitter handle, and optionally their picture. The query filters for individuals whose occupation is a subclass of "politician" (Q82955), ensuring relevant roles are included. Labels are returned in English for readability.

context: Characters whose actors died recently
target: This SPARQL query finds characters played by actors who have died within the last 50 days. It searches for actors linked to characters either through detailed statement qualifiers or direct properties, ensuring the characters are instances or subclasses of "character" (Q95074). The results list actor and character names in English, ordered by actor.

context: UEFA teams and the number of players on the team
target: This SPARQL query retrieves UEFA teams, their labels, the year associated with a relevant date, and the count of players per team. It identifies teams by specific Wikidata classes, counts players linked via a property, and selects the most relevant date from two possible properties. It also checks for related French and German Wikipedia articles. Results are ordered by year.

context: Species of birds and their sounds
target: This SPARQL query retrieves up to 10,000 bird species along with their labels and associated audio files of their sounds from Wikidata. It selects entities classified as birds (using taxonomic hierarchy) that have linked audio recordings. The query also fetches labels in the user's language or English for easy readability, enabling exploration of bird species and their calls.

context: Archaeological sites and remains in Malaysia with National Heritage status
target: This SPARQL query retrieves archaeological sites in Malaysia that have been designated as National Heritage (property P1435 with value Q113756521). For each site (?tapak), it fetches its label in the preferred language (auto-detected or Malay) and optionally its geographic coordinates (property P625). This helps map and identify protected heritage locations.

query:
# Wikidata Map of Filming Locations
# by Jura1, rev. 2016-10-28, excludes countries
#defaultView:Map
SELECT 
	?film ?title ?filmLabel ?filmDescription 
	?filminglocation ?filminglocationLabel ?coor
WHERE
{
	?film wdt:P31 wd:Q11424 .
  	?film wdt:P915 ?filminglocation .
  	?filminglocation wdt:P625 ?coor .
  	OPTIONAL { ?film wdt:P1476 ?title } .
  	FILTER NOT EXISTS { ?filminglocation wdt:P17 ?filminglocation }
	SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en,en" }
}
context: Map of Filming Locations, excludes countries
target: This SPARQL query retrieves films and their specific filming locations, excluding countries, from Wikidata. It selects films (instances of "film") along with their titles and descriptions, then finds associated filming locations that have geographic coordinates. For each sculpture, it fetches one representative image and its label, displaying them in a grid for easy browsing.

target: This SPARQL query finds authors who have cited one or more articles written by a specific researcher identified by their ORCID (here, "0000-0001-7542-0286"). The results exclude self-citations and are ordered by the number of citations, providing insight into your scholarly impact and social presence.

context: Of the official mottos of U.S. states, there are more in Latin than in English
target: This SPARQL query counts the number of official mottos ("devise") of U.S. states grouped by the language they are written in. This reveals, for example, that more state mottos are in Latin than English.

target: This SPARQL query retrieves items classified as instances or subclasses of the LGBT concept (wd:Q115870510) that have more than two Wikipedia site links, excluding those with an English Wikipedia article. context: Of the 15424 existing subway stations on Earth, 5726 of them are in
target: This SPARQL query counts the number of currently operating subway stations in each country. The results show how many active subway stations each country has, ideal for visualizing with a bar chart.

context: Map of tripoints known to Wikidata
target: This SPARQL query retrieves all tripoints—geographical points where three borders meet—recorded in Wikidata. It selects each tripoint’s identifier, its label (name), and geographic coordinates. The results enable mapping these tripoints, as shown by the default map view directive, helping visualize where multiple borders converge worldwide.

This SPARQL query retrieves data about French nuclear tests for mapping. It selects each test’s item, label, date, and estimated explosive yield in kilotons (converted from joules). It fetches geographic coordinates either directly or via the test location. Tests are categorized into four yield ranges as map layers. Labels are returned in the user’s language or English, enabling a visual map of French nuclear tests by date and power.

context: What Wikidata album languages grew the most this week?
target: This SPARQL query counts the number of albums (entities classified as Q482994) grouped by their language of publication (property P407). It retrieves each language along with its label and orders the results by descending album count, showing which languages have the most albums. This helps track language trends in album data on Wikidata.

context: Emergency number by country size
target: This SPARQL query retrieves emergency phone numbers, showing how many countries use each number and the total population covered. It identifies emergency numbers (instances of emergency number class), counts countries that have them, sums their populations, and fetches the phone number itself. Results are ordered by population size, ideal for visualizing coverage impact.

context: Countries with most UNESCO World Heritage Sites
target: This SPARQL query retrieves a list of countries ranked by the number of UNESCO World Heritage Sites they have. It selects distinct countries and counts the sites associated with each. Using Wikidata properties, it filters for sites designated as UNESCO World Heritage Sites (wdt:P1435 = wd:Q9259), groups results by country, and orders them from highest to lowest count. The query also fetches country labels in English for readability.

context: People with songs named after them
target: This SPARQL query retrieves songs or poems named after people. It finds works classified as songs or poems, identifies the person they’re named for, and gathers details like the work’s title, type, and year, plus the namesake’s name, birth year, and death year if available. Labels are included for easy reading in the user’s language.

target: This SPARQL query retrieves black-and-white movies filmed in Greece after 2000 that feature an actor who has appeared on Saturday Night Live. Each movie must have a female assistant director who studied in the USA, be written by an Oscar-nominated screenwriter, and have music composed by a blind Lutheran. It combines film metadata with detailed creator attributes to produce this specific list.
